course.title: Social Structure and Culture in the Study of Race and Urban Poverty
course.description: The purpose of this course is to critically examine current writings and debates on how social structure and culture affect the social outcomes of the African Americans and immigrants in the US. The relevance of these works for public and social policy will also be discussed.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Kennedy School as SUP-207 (Formerly AAAS 211)
